description:
Moritaka Mashiro and Akito Takagi are pretty much foils of each other. Mashiro, an average 9th grade student but talented artist, and Takagi, an overall advanced 9th grader and aspiring writer. After great convincing, Takagi convinces Mashiro to join him in becoming the greatest mangakas Japan has ever seen. Takagi, with his gift of writing, hopes to become a successful mangaka, and Mashiro, with his gift of art, hopes to marry the girl of his dreams, Azuki Miho.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

title.native: バクマン。 スペシャル「デラマン。」

node.description:
**Height:** 165cm 
**Favorite color:** Black
**Graduated:** Meiji University

**[Artist Profile (Add9th)](https://add9th.co.jp/profile/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MorikuBorn)**

Shoutarou Morikubo is a Japanese voice actor who has been active in anime, drama CDs, and video games. He's the founder and representative director of [Add9th](https://add9th.co.jp/). He has additionally released song singles, a CD album, and a concert DVD. He was formerly affiliated with I'm Enterprise and VIMS.

In 2018, he formed the musical unit [buzz☆Vibes](https://anilist.co/staff/160730/buzzVibes) with Japanese multitalent [Shinnosuke](https://anilist.co/staff/160731/Shinnosuke).

Michael Tremain Sinterniklaas is a French-American voice actor, ADR director and script writer who has provided voices for a number of English language versions of Japanese anime films and television series, as well as cartoons and video games. He has worked for Studiopolis, Funimation, 4K Media, Central Park Media, Bandai Entertainment, Viz Media and Media Blasters. He is the founder and owner of NYAV Post, a Bi-coastal studio located in New York City and Los Angeles, which dubbed many different anime titles and recorded several original prelay works.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://x.com/T_Obata_info) | [Twitter (Old)](https://twitter.com/obata_ten)

Takeshi Obata is a Japanese manga artist that usually works as the illustrator in collaboration with a writer. He first gained international attention for [Hikaru no Go](https://anilist.co/manga/30020/Hikaru-no-Go/) (1998–2003) with [Yumi Hotta](https://anilist.co/staff/96889/Yumi-Hotta), but is better known for [Death Note](https://anilist.co/manga/30021/Death-Note/) (2003–2006) and [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/manga/39711/Bakuman/) (2008–2012) with [Tsugumi Ohba](https://anilist.co/staff/97111/Tsugumi-Ohba). Obata has mentored several well-known manga artists, including [Nobuhiro Watsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/96890/Nobuhiro-Watsuki) of [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/manga/30022/Rurouni-Kenshin-Meiji-Kenkaku-Romantan/) fame, [Black Cat](https://anilist.co/manga/30040/Black-Cat/) creator [Kentaro Yabuki](https://anilist.co/staff/96900/Kentarou-Yabuki), and [Eyeshield 21](https://anilist.co/manga/30043/Eyeshield-21/) artist [Yusuke Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/96903/Yusuke-Murata).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

Tsugumi Ooba is a fictional writer credited with writing the manga Death Note. Their real identity (and gender) is a closely guarded secret

Day and night, develops manga plots while holding knees on a chair (reminiscent of one of the main characters in Death Note, L.)

They like to collect teacups.

(Source: VIZ Media)

[Official Site](https://www.hyde.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HydeOfficial_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hydeofficial) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@hyde_official) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPiJhfvRuQqQofd3xSZBQ1A)

Hideto Takarai, better known as HYDE, is a Japanese musician, vocalist, lyricist, record producer, actor and voice actor. He is best known as the vocalist for the rock band L'Arc~en~Ciel, as well as for the band Vamps. In the band L'Arc~en~Ciel he stylized his name as hyde, while in his solo projects and in the band Vamps he stylized it as HYDE. He is currently active in the band L'Arc~en~Ciel (1991–) under the name HYDE (2001–), while also a member of Vamps (2008–2017), who are currently on hiatus.

Hironobu Kageyama is a Japanese musical artist prominent in the soundtracks for anime, video game, and tokusatsu productions. He is sometimes called Kami by his fans. Kageyama got his big break at age 16, as lead singer of the pop group LAZY. By the early '80s, the band split and Kageyama went solo. He found major success once he started to sing the theme songs of anime and tokusatsu shows. Becoming immensely popular soon after, Kageyama went on to be dubbed the "Prince of Anime/Tokusatsu Songs" and is a main fixture for shows to this day. He also got the nickname "Mr. DBZ" by fans of Dragon Ball Z as he did the most songs for that anime. He is an original member and the current leader of the popular vocal group JAM Project. Also, along with Masaaki Endoh, he hosts "Anipara Ongakukan", a TV show that aired at Kids Station. One of the few voice acting roles he performed was Zaruba of the tokusatsu series GARO.

[Website](http://www.airblanca.com/)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/カサヰケンイチ)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/カサヰケンイチ)

__[Website](https://kobukuro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TeamKobukuro) | [Instagram (run by Shunsuke)](https://www.instagram.com/kobukuro_kuroda_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/kobukuroofficialTV)__

__Formed:__ 1998

__Introduction:__
Kobukuro is a Japanese musical duo under record label Warner Music Japan (2001–), having previously been under MINOSUKE RECORDS (1999–2000), who have been active between September 1998 and August 2011, with a break between August 2011 and March 2012, resuming band activities from April 2012.

The name of the unit stems from the first four letters from each of the members' family name, where Kobu comes from __Kobu__chi, while Kuro comes from __Kuro__da.

__Members:__
- [Shunsuke Kuroda](https://anilist.co/staff/173356/Shunsuke-Kuroda) (黒田俊介, くろだしゅんすけ) – vocalist, sometimes in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Kentarou Kobuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/173355/Kentarou-Kobuchi) (小渕健太郎, こぶちけんたろう) – guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

Audio Highs is a Japanese music composer and arranger. They are mostly known for work in Gintama series as music creator.

He passed away from undisclosed causes in January 2020.
Affiliated with [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Originally from [Brain's Base](https://anilist.co/studio/112/).

__Yu Takahashi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger, formerly signed to record label Amuse and now under Warner Music Japan.
